column3: Should `std::byte` be used for raw bytes now that we're on c++17?
I don't think we can use `std::byte` because it is type-safe. Using it would require changing all code (net, hashes, ...) or adding verbose wrappers again.
Don't you just hate it when too much type safety gets in the way of using the standard library.

Concept ACK\n\nI was personally never convinced that `std::byte` adds that much type safety over using unsigned 8-bit integers as bytes (which at least makes manipulating them architecture-independent, without signedness sharp edges). I like `uint8_t` myself.

I like how this gets rid of all the casts except the one at the OS boundary (`recv`). no more casting back and forth. `CDataStream` next? :smile: \n\nCode review ACK fabecce71909c984504c21fa05f91d5f1b471e8c
